item.title: A Prosopography as Linked Open Data: Some Implications from DPRR
item.author: John Douglas Bradley
item.description: In a TED conference in 2009 Tim Berners-Lee gave a presentation entitled The Year open data went worldwide [bernerslee2010] . In it he gave some examples of how open data fromgovernments, scientists and institutionscould be used to make significant statements about the state of affairs in society. He then asked governments, scientists and institutions to support this kind of work by making more of their data freely available in a form where it could be further processed rather than just looked at.
